page.title: 01SWINSTEAD VILLAGE AND AREA
page.content: Swinstead Village and Area (GR05000321) The area is gently undulating except in the west where the River Glen has carved a valley through the limestone. All the land in the area is owned by the Grimsthorpe and Drummond Trust and they let the land out to tenant farmers. The farmimg is mixed (arable and grass for milk cows) and there are a number of woods. The only village is Swinstead (pop. c.250). There are two commercial properties in the village - the Post Ofice and the Public House (The Windmill). Travelling shops come to the village. Most of the houses are owned by the Trust but there are a few privately owned houses and a small council estate. There is also a sheltered Old People's estate. The building material is largely stone with pantiled roofs although there
